channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Litter still has not been cleaned, 18th June
item.description:
I reported this problem several days ago today I got a message to say that the problem has been resolved but as you can see from the picture it clearly hasn’t and there is still a huge amount of litter all along Wilberforce Road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Fly tipping, 18th June
item.description:
Rubbish all in the bushes on the grounds of Charlesworth Court. (Mainly toys this time). The people in the flat above the entrance often throw rubbish and food over their balcony or out of their window onto the ground below.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Wood Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Speed Bump on Carriage Drive, 18th June
item.description:
I’m writing to report a cycling hazard in Southwark Park that caused me to fall off my e-bike on 18th June 2025 While riding through the park, I lost control at a raised cobbled section located on Carriage Drive (just before a bend). As I attempted to turn across it, my front wheel slipped on the uneven cobbles. I fell hard, with my e-bike landing on top of me. I’ve suffered bruising, swelling, and minor injuries as a result. Several passers-by who helped me mentioned that other cyclists have also fallen at the same location, which suggests this is a recurring and serious issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ann Moss Way, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household rubbish, 18th June
item.description:
Bags of household rubbish were Infront of the bin store last Wednesday. By the following morning these had been ripped open and the rubbish strewn all around the grounds and blowing into Greening Street. The area is unsightly and a heath hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greening Street, Abbey Wood, London

item.title: Someone has dumped broken stacks of wood in the church front garden., 18th June
item.description:
Someone has dumped broken stacks of wood in the church front garden. We have a.number of bags of soil ready to be worked into the garden. Someone has come along seen the soil and assumed it was rubbish. They then proceeded to dump their own building rubbish directly on top of them and left it. Please help us to remove the wood (and leave our bags of soil as they are) Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lorrimore Square, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing public health concern with homeless woman, 18th June
item.description:
A homeless woman has been living at the top of sunny hill Road opposite the Lidl for months. She urinates in bottles, soils herself, and the smell is unbearable. The area is filthy and completely unhygienic. Passers-by keep feeding her, but nothing is being done about the mess or the public health risk. This is unacceptable in a public space. The council needs to act now – this is a disgrace and it’s affecting the whole area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 222-224, Streatham High Road, Streatham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins, bin bags and loose rubish all over the pavement, 18th June
item.description:
Today is rubbish and recycling day in the street and refuse was collected this morning. Yet this evening the pavement is strewn with more rubbish including soiled nappies on the kerb and in the road on one of the hottest days of the year.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Olinda Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
